etymology.description: 誇(誇): semantic 言(言) (yán, 'words, language') + phonetic 夸(夸) (kuā, 'boast') -> 'boastful or exaggerated words'
etymology.interpretation: In 誇(誇), the element 言(言) relates to 'words' or 'speech', indicating the act of speaking in a boastful manner; 夸(夸) provides the phonetic component, reinforcing the sound and meaning of boasting.
etymology.simplification: 夸(誇): In simplified form, 言(言) ('words') is removed, leaving only 夸 to represent boasting, simplifying by removing the semantic component.

examples.chinese: 他总爱夸自己会说多种语言(他總愛夸自己會說多種語言)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zǒng ài kuā zìjǐ huì shuō duō zhǒng yǔyán.
examples.english: He always loves to boast about his ability to speak multiple languages.

examples.chinese: 他在聚会中夸自己的财富(他在聚會中夸自己的財富)，引得旁人侧目(引得旁人側目)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài jùhuì zhōng kuā zìjǐ de cáifù, yǐn de pángrén cèmù.
examples.english: He boasts about his wealth at the party, drawing sideways glances from others.
